bibl.title: Some Egyptian Datings from the Reign of Phocas.
bibl.note: I. An early dating by Phocas: A Hermopolite land lease of 603 [Hermopolis, 30 August - 28 September 603]. - II. The "early" recognition of Phocas in Egypt. - III. Some aberrant dates from Oxyrhynchus. - IV. An interesting Coptic inscription or further evidence on Phocas' consular count.

bibl.title: Essays and Texts in Honor of J. David Thomas

bibl.seg: 141.4 P. E.E.S. Misc. Inv. II 191b = P. Thomas 30
GONIS Nikolaos, Some Egyptian Datings from the Reign of Phocas.
Traianos GAGOS and Roger S. BAGNALL (Edd.), Essays and Texts in Honor of J. David Thomas = American Studies in Papyrology. 42 (Oakville, Connecticut, 2001) pp. 255-262 et pl. 23.

I. An early dating by Phocas: A Hermopolite land lease of 603 [Hermopolis, 30 August - 28 September 603]. - II. The "early" recognition of Phocas in Egypt. - III. Some aberrant dates from Oxyrhynchus. - IV. An interesting Coptic inscription or further evidence on Phocas' consular count.
